H0.text: In which of Thomas Hardy's novels is Bathsheba Everdene the heroine. Tess of the d'Urbervilles

H1.text: In which of Thomas Hardy's novels is Bathsheba Everdene the heroine. Jude the Obscure

H2.text: In which of Thomas Hardy's novels is Bathsheba Everdene the heroine. The Return of the Native

H3.text: In which of Thomas Hardy's novels is Bathsheba Everdene the heroine. Gabriel Oak

A4.text: The novel in which Bathsheba Everdene is the heroine is titled 'Far from the Madding Crowd'.

A6.text: The novel in which Bathsheba Everdene is the heroine is titled 'Far from the Madding Crowd', not 'Tess of the d'Urbervilles'.

A7.text: The novel in which Bathsheba Everdene is the heroine is titled 'Far from the Madding Crowd', not 'Jude the Obscure'.

A8.text: The novel in which Bathsheba Everdene is the heroine is titled 'Far from the Madding Crowd', not 'The Return of the Native'.

A9.text: Gabriel Oak is a character in 'Far from the Madding Crowd', not a novel.
